definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To give up ; to relinquish ownership of. [from 14th c.]
( transitive ) To hand over (something to someone), place into the care or control of another.
( transitive or intransitive ) To voluntarily leave ( a job or position ) , in particular a hard-fought position of high status. [from 14th c.]
examples: I am resigning in protest of the unfair treatment of our employees.
He resigned the crown to follow his heart.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To submit passively; to give up as hopeless or inevitable . [from 15th c.]
